PHASE SUMMARY — Lord Glenarvan — early

Role: 
Lord Glenarvan is the owner of the yacht Duncan and appears to be in charge of the vessel.

Traits:
- He is calm and composed, as seen when he orders the sailors to wash a piece of rock that the shark has taken in for ballast.
- He is a noble, as indicated by the ducal coronet on the blue pennon bearing his initials.

Relationships:
- He is married to Lady Helena, as seen in the conversation about the bottle.
- He is the father of Lord Edward, as indicated by the conversation between Lord Edward and Lady Helena.

Notable behaviors:
- He gives orders to the sailors, showing his authority as the owner of the yacht.
- He is interested in the origin of a mysterious bottle found on the yacht.
